basis: The user consistently articulates clear intent to follow the plan, specifying steps (3-minute breathing, one-line mood/hunger log, printable backup card, reminders) and a concrete tonight-with-tough-night contingency.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. Minor tension between maintaining structure (logging) and flexibility (adjusting labels), but addressed with explicit planning to adapt as needed.
negative_thought_patterns: Occasional anticipatory worry about tougher nights and tweaking labels, suggesting mild perfectionism and concern about long-term consistency.
emotional_triggers: Evening urges/hunger spikes, environmental factors (heat, dehydration), potential social interruptions, fear of missing logs during busy moments.
effective_reinforcement: Positive reinforcement when logs are completed
coaching_notes: Keep delivering concise, concrete prompts; reinforce the value of micro-logging and quick notes for spike events; ensure offline backup remains accessible; consider separate reminder profiles for home vs. out and encourage end-of-evening reflection to refine labels.
